Class Item

  • java.lang.Object
    • RenderableObject
      • Item
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GlobalHelper
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Boost, Oil, Tomato

    public abstract class Item
extends RenderableObject

    Item

    Abstract class from which all concrete Item classes inherit.

    The main role of this class is to handle initially creating the Items on the map and then managing their update and render each game turn. A series of abstract methods are also defined to ensure that these tasks can be carried out in a centralised manner with the static methods here in Item. Only two non-static methods are defined here. One which renders the Item explicitly onto the screen. This is so Panel can display the currently held item. The second applies the Tomato/Oil effect upon hitting their active forms, as these two effects are exactly the same.
    Author:
    Daniel Porteous porteousd 696965

    • Method Detail

      • applyEffect

        public abstract boolean applyEffect(Racer racer,
                                    java.util.ArrayList<Item> mapItems)
                             throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        Specifying that each Item derived from this class must have a useEffect method which can be called when the Item is collided with.
        Parameters:
        racer - The racer with which the collision occurs.
        mapItems - All the items on the map, so a new item can be added when the active effect of an item is activated.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the effect duration has completed (i.e. Boost duration or duration for which to apply the Oil/Tomato effect).
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException

      • isActive

        public abstract boolean isActive()
        This method returns true if the item is active on the map. This is useful because Enemies can only interact with active items.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the item is in its active state on the map.

      • update

        public abstract boolean update(World world)
        This function is used for Items for which we need to know if we need to delete them from the map based on a condition specific to that item. As such, Oil and Boost will always return false, because the Boost has no active presence on the map and the Oil slick is removed by the collision methods in Racer. The tomato, however, needs to be removed upon colliding with terrain, and as such will have a method here that checks for that. It also updates its position as it flies across the map
        Parameters:
        world - The world object so terrain collisions can be checked.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the item being updated needs to be removed from the map, used only for Tomato since its the only item with an additional removal condition that isn't collision with a Racer, namely collision with terrain.

      • createItems

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Item> createItems()
                                             throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        This method is called statically from world upon initialisation. It creates all the items by reading them in from the items.txt data file and then returning them in an ArrayList.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList containing all the items on the map.
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException

      • renderExplicitly

        public void renderExplicitly(double x,
                             double y)
        Draws the Item explicitly to given coordinates on the screen. This is used in Panel to draw the item in the circle in the bottom right.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate to draw the top left corner of the Item to.
        y - The y-coordinate to draw the top left corner of the Item to.

      • updateItems

        public static void updateItems(java.util.ArrayList<Item> mapItems,
                               World world)
        This method is passed the items on the map from World, as well as world itself. The update method for each item is then called. If the update method returns true, that means the Item is signaling that something has happened to it meaning that it needs to be removed from the map, to which we oblige.
        Parameters:
        mapItems - An ArrayList containing the items on the map.
        world - The world object. This is passed so items can check for terrain collisions and such.

      • renderItems

        public static void renderItems(java.util.ArrayList<Item> mapItems,
                               double camX,
                               double camY)
        Currently this just renders every item in the game world without consideration for if they are actually in the screen frame. Calculations could be introduced which calculates whether the item is in the game window and therefore if it needs to be rendered. However, calculating whether an item is in the game window or not for each item could end up being more expensive than just rendering them all considering the fairly low cost of rendering a small 2D sprite. With this in mind, it's probably lighter weight to keep the method as is.
        Parameters:
        mapItems - The items currently on the map.
        camX - Current x-coordinate of the Camera.
        camY - Current y-coordinate of the Camera.

      • applyOilTomatoEffect

        public void applyOilTomatoEffect(Racer racer)
        This effect is held here in Item because it is common to both Oil and Tomato. Simply applies the acceleration and turning lock and angularModifier specified in the spec.
        Parameters:
        racer - Racer to which the effect should be applied
